intro: Dactylostemon angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dactylostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
